meanings.definition: A pipe or chamber branching into several openings
meanings.sent1: The manifolds in the engine distribute air to different parts.
meanings.sent2: The plumber fixed the manifolds in the heating system.
meanings.sent3: The manifolds in the garden hose made watering the plants much easier.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts flowed through her mind like manifolds, branching into various directions.
meanings.sent5: The manifolds of the maze led the visitors on a confusing journey.

meanings.definition: A collection of connected pipes or channels
meanings.sent1: The manifolds in the factory carried liquids to different machines.
meanings.sent2: The sewage system had manifolds that directed waste to the treatment plant.
meanings.sent3: The manifolds of straws at the party made it easy for guests to choose a drink.
meanings.sent4: The manifolds of roads in the city connected various neighborhoods.
meanings.sent5: The manifolds of wires in the computer network ensured smooth data flow.

meanings.definition: A set of points forming a certain kind of set, such as a topological space
meanings.sent1: The manifolds in mathematics help define complex shapes.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the manifolds to understand the structure of the universe.
meanings.sent3: The manifolds of stars in the sky created a beautiful constellation.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions intertwined like manifolds, forming a complex web of feelings.
meanings.sent5: The manifolds of colors in the painting blended harmoniously.
